intro: Senecio madidiensis, commonly known as the Madidi groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests, where it thrives in the humid conditions. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive shape, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio madidiensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
